com.foxhole.tools.spartan.states
Class PositionalGameState

java.lang.Object
  com.foxhole.tools.spartan.states.AbstractGameState
      com.foxhole.tools.spartan.states.PositionalGameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
IFormPosition, INonRenderableSpartanObject, ISpartanObject, IGameStateObject
public class PositionalGameState
extends AbstractGameState
implements IFormPosition

The game state that represents the entire spectrum of transformations that an form might possess. It also contains the Shape used for for collision checking.

Initialization by XML:

NameString FormDescriptionExample
IDENTIFIER[String]A string representing the identifier of the statePositionalGameState
POSITION[float],[float]An float Tuple separated by a ','3.0,2.1
ROTATION[float]A single float representing an angle in degrees35.1
SCALE[float]A single float representing the scale of the object2.0
CENTER_POSITIONX,YAn float Tuple separated by a ','3.0,2.1
DIRECTIONX,YAn float Tuple separated by a ','3.0,2.1
COLLISION_AREA[float],[float];[float],[float];...;[float],[float]A list of at least three float value tuples0f,0f;1f,0f;1f,1f;0f,1f;

Author:
Tiago "Spiegel" Costa

setCenterPosition

public final void setCenterPosition(float x,
                                    float y)
Description copied from interface: IFormPosition
Sets the center position of the object. Add rotations and scales use this point as reference. The coordinates for this point refer to the coordinates (0,0) of the form, so in order to put the center of rotation on a image with 200 width and 100 height, the center of rotation should be (100, 50). Even thought the position of the image form might change the center of rotation wont.

Specified by:
setCenterPosition in interface IFormPosition
Parameters:
x - a float containing the X coordinate of the center position point.
y - a float containing the Y coordinate of the center position point.

setCenterPosition

public final void setCenterPosition(org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f centerPosition)
Description copied from interface: IFormPosition
Sets the center position of the object. Add rotations and scales use this point as reference. The coordinates for this point refer to the coordinates (0,0) of the form, so in order to put the center of rotation on a image with 200 width and 100 height, the center of rotation should be (100, 50). Even thought the position of the image form might change the center of rotation wont.

Specified by:
setCenterPosition in interface IFormPosition
Parameters:
centerPosition - a vector containing the x,y coordinate of the center position point.
